topic.title: Database as a Service: 2.0 Beta Release Notes

section.title: Monasca
section.p: The following instructions will enable the monasca agent on the DBaaS control plane for beta. These instructions require that you are able to ssh onto the control plane.

ol.li:
Secure copy the following packages onto each control plane instance:
Six-1.9.0
Python-keystoneclinet-0.10.1
Oslo.i18n-1.5.0
Pbr-0.11.0
Oslo.utils-1.4.0
Oslo.serialization-1.4.0
Stevedore-1.3.0
Oslo.config-1.3.0
Use pip install to install the packages in the order listed above
Run bash /etc/monasca/start-monasca. This will setup the monasca agent on the machine.

section.title: Failure to create the database endpoint
section.p: In some cases, the beta installer may fail to create the database endpoint at the end of the installation. If you hit this issue, you can create a database endpoint by running the following commands (replace the IP address of the VIP as appropriate):
section.codeblock: $ openstack service create --name database database $ openstack endpoint create database admin 'http://<public-VIP-IP-address>:8779/v1.0/$(tenant_id)s’ $ openstack endpoint create database internal 'http://<public-VIP-IP-address>:8779/v1.0/$(tenant_id)s’ $ openstack endpoint create database public 'http://<public-VIP-IP-address>:8779/v1.0/$(tenant_id)s’
